result.execSummary:
The defendant Louis Travania Lister was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain employment and/or continue with education.
Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Louis Travania Lister

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: 08:33 AM Defendant Louis Travania Lister in court by video means, in custody at the Rock County Jail and with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video means.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom.  Defendant pleads guilty; Court finds defendant guilty.  Defendant waives right to pre sentence investigation. Court orders 18 months Wisconsin State Prison and 18 months Extended Supervision, any treatment deemed necessary, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, maintain employment and/or continue with education, DOC collect costs, 0 days sentence credit. Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.

03:15 PM Defendant Louis Travania Lister in court by video in custody with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video.  David S Olson and Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Signature bond of $500 set with conditions of court orders Level 2 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Not to drive at all. Maintain absolute sobriety.
